Uses of Class
com.samskivert.servlet.user.User

Packages that use User
com.samskivert.servlet.user Provides services for managing a database of users in a web application or suite of web applications. 
 

Uses of User in com.samskivert.servlet.user
 

Methods in com.samskivert.servlet.user that return User
 User UserManager.loadUser(HttpServletRequest req)
          Fetches the necessary authentication information from the http request and loads the user identified by that information.
 User UserRepository.loadUser(int userId)
          Looks up a user by userid.
 User UserRepository.loadUser(String username)
          Looks up a user by username.
 User UserManager.loadUser(String authcode)
          Loads up a user based on the supplied session authentication token.
 User UserRepository.loadUserBySession(String sessionKey)
          Looks up a user by a session identifier.
 User UserManager.login(String username, Password password, boolean persist, HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse rsp, Authenticator auth)
          Attempts to authenticate the requester and initiate an authenticated session for them.
 User UserManager.requireUser(HttpServletRequest req)
          Fetches the necessary authentication information from the http request and loads the user identified by that information.
 

Methods in com.samskivert.servlet.user that return types with arguments of type User

          Looks up users by userid
 Tuple<User,String> UserManager.login(String username, Password password, int expires, Authenticator auth)
          Attempts to authenticate the requester and initiate an authenticated session for them.
 ArrayList<User> UserRepository.lookupUsersByEmail(String email)
          Lookup a user by email address, something that is not efficient and should really only be done by site admins attempting to look up a user record.
 ArrayList<User> UserRepository.lookupUsersWhere(String where)
          Looks up a list of users that match an arbitrary query.
 

Methods in com.samskivert.servlet.user with parameters of type User

 void Authenticator.authenticateUser(User user, String username, Password password)
          Checks whether the user should be authenticated based on the supplied user record and the specified user information.
 void UserRepository.deleteUser(User user)
          'Delete' the users account such that they can no longer access it, however we do not delete the record from the db.
 void UserManager.effectLogin(User user, int expires, HttpServletRequest req, HttpServletResponse rsp)
          If a user is already known to be authenticated for one reason or other, this method can be used to give them the appropriate authentication cookies to effect their login.
static String UserUtil.genAuthCode(User user)
          Generates a new random session identifier for the supplied user.
 String UserRepository.registerSession(User user, int expireDays)
          Creates a new session for the specified user and returns the randomly generated session identifier for that session.
 boolean UserRepository.updateUser(User user)
          Updates a user that was previously fetched from the repository.
